tool.name: Network2DTo3D
tool.displayname: 3D Network Generation from 2D Network and DEM

param.name: Input_Surface
param.dialogReference: The DTM/DEM raster from which elevation data will be added to the 3D network.

param.name: Distance
param.dialogReference: The distance at which to split the network to calculate slope, travel time, and energy.

param.name: FalseSplit
param.dialogReference: Network has No Split edges (optional): If checked, this parameter indicates that your input 2D network has lines that should not be split by the tool (such as bridges).

param.name: FalseSlope
param.dialogReference: Network has No Slope edges (optional): If checked, this parameter indicates that your input 2D network has edges that should not have their travel time based on the slope of the terrain.

param.name: Network_3D
param.dialogReference: The output 3D pedestrian network for further analysis.

param.name: BodyMass
param.dialogReference: Individual body weight (in kg) used in calculating energy costs.

param.name: Carried_Load
param.expression: Load Weight in kg;Load Weight in kg...
param.dialogReference: Load weights to be used in calculating energy costs. A separate field will be added to the output feature for every load weight entered.

param.name: velocity_eq
param.expression: Standard Tobler | Marquez-Perez et al. | Irmischer and Clarke Male On-Path | Irmischer and Clarke Female On-Path | Tobler 3.5 kmh max | Tobler Urban Adjustment
param.dialogReference: The velocity equation to be used in calculating walk times and energy costs. If more than one is checked, new fields will be added to the output file for each load weight / velocity combination, as well travel time (in minutes), and speed (m/s).

tool.summary: Using an input pedestrian network and a Digital Elevation/Terrain Model (DEM/DTM), this Python Toolbox for ArcGIS Pro/10.4 or greater implements Tobler’s Hiking Function and/or related walking velocity equations to enable the calculation of slope-aware travel times for walking travel on a 3D network. It will also calculate the metabolic cost (in kcals) of carrying various loads, given an individual body mass and load weights.

idCitation.resTitle: 3D Network Generation from 2D Network and DEM

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Using an input pedestrian network and a Digital Elevation/Terrain Model (DEM/DTM), this Python Toolbox for ArcGIS Pro/10.4 or greater implements Tobler’s Hiking Function and/or related walking velocity equations to enable the calculation of slope-aware travel times for walking travel on a 3D network. It will also calculate the metabolic cost (in kcals) of carrying various loads, given an individual body mass and load weights.
